required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Accuracy of ECOM Plus Versus Pulmonary Artery Catheter
clinical_study.official_title: Accuracy of the ECOM Plus Hemodynamic Monitor Versus Pulmonary Artery Catheter

brief_summary.textblock: This Study will compare the accuracy of the ECOM Plus Endotracheal Cardiac Output Monitor (ECOM) without the use of the arterial pressure waveform from the arterial line to 1) the current clinical standard of cardiac output measured by intermittent room temperature bolus thermodilution using a PAC, 2) the current ECOM System with the use of the arterial blood pressure waveform from a radial arterial line and 3) the Flo-Trac® System.

detailed_description.textblock: This Study will compare the accuracy of the ECOM Plus Endotracheal Cardiac Output Monitor (ECOM) without the use of the arterial pressure waveform from the arterial line to 1) the current clinical standard of cardiac output measured by intermittent room temperature bolus thermodilution using a PAC, 2) the current ECOM System with the use of the arterial blood pressure waveform from a radial arterial line and 3) the Flo-Trac® System (Edwards LifeSciences).

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of ECOM Plus impedance and thermal dilution cardiac output measurements
primary_outcome.description: Correlation via linear regression between thermal dilution and ECOM Plus included as an "R" to coefficient. Cardiac output measured by thermal dilution and impedance cardiography. Management of the patients using standard thermal dilution derived CO measurement only. The ECOM Plus measurement output are for research purposes only and not to be used in the management of the patient. ECOM Plus impedance cardiography measured in the ICU when routine thermal dilution CO measurements are made. Continued impedance measurements until tracheal extubation.

arm_group.description: ECOM endotracheal cardiac output monitor in patients undergoing cardiac and liver surgery.

intervention.description: Measure cardiac output during perioperative period and compare to pulmonary artery catheter thermal dilution cardiac output measurement.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients able to give informed consent.
- Patients undergoing surgery that would routinely require use of an endotracheal, pulmonary artery catheter and arterial catheter.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who do not speak English.
- Patients not competent to give informed consent.

reference.citation: Wallace AW, Salahieh A, Lawrence A, Spector K, Owens C, Alonso D. Endotracheal cardiac output monitor. Anesthesiology. 2000 Jan;92(1):178-89.
